author: Special Correspondent
text:
They want Centre and UT to drop hovercraft port proposal in Veerampattinam completely

The procession by people from 18 fishing villages, which started from Singaravelar statue, was blocked near the Head Post Office in Puducherry on Thursday.— PHOTO: M. Samraj

The fisherfolk from 18 coastal villages took out a massive procession opposing the establishment of a Coast Guard Centre and a hovercraft Port in Veerampattinam village.

Though the villagers have been opposed to the proposal since 2004, their agitation picked up momentum following release of the land to the Coast Guard and the formal laying of foundation by Chief Minister N. Rangasamy on January 15.

Skipping fishing activities, the fishermen from these villages took out a massive procession from Singaravelar statue towards the Legislative Assembly.

P. Sakthivel a member of the struggle committee said, “We have decided to take out a massive procession urging the government to give up the proposal.”

They were blocked near the Head Post Office and they shouted slogans urging the Centre and UT governments to give up the proposals completely.

Police bandobust was beefed up along the route of the procession.
title: Fisherfolk take out a massive rally
